description.narrative: The project aims to integrate human rights for lesbian and transgender into the mainstream of LGBT rights.  Data and information on the lesbian and transgender from this project will be utilized for stronger advocacy work. Problem analysis: Based on results of current program, there is a need to increase skills and capacity of lesbians and transgender women in the mainstream LGBT rights movement. Lesbian did not involve in any local movement while gay people had opportunities under HIV prevention programs over a decade. Transgender were never given an opportunity to promote their identity from human rights perspective but their sexuality falls in the category of MSM. Goal: To increase CRB’s organizational capacity to lead exclusive national LGBT rights movement with a special focus on mainstreaming lesbian and transgender rights into human rights movement. Expected results are: -CRB's organizational capacity is increased. -Lesbian and transgender women rights are included and integrated in women's rights movement.  CRB offices in Yangon and Dawei will implement HR trainings targeting lesbian and transgender women. CB training for CRB staff will be organized for stronger operation and management for organizational development. The training will serve as platform to emerge lesbian and transgender groups in strategic ways in long term collaboration with other CRB’s activities for promotion and prevention of rights of LGBT community as well as access to justice. Public awareness campaigns will further supports to raise awareness of LGBT issues and society’s perceptive towards LGBT community. CR focuses on gender in all of their work particularly lesbian and transgender women.  Thematic area of the project is human rights focus on LGBT rights.
This project mainly contributes to results within Empowerment of human rights defenders. Results will be reported later in the Global Civsam grant period 2016-2020
